wikipedia_page.main: Edward Stanley Gibbons (21 June 1840 – 17 February 1913)  was an English stamp dealer and founder of Stanley Gibbons Ltd, publishers of the famous Stanley Gibbons stamp catalogue and other stamp-related books and magazines.

response: * February 17 – Edward Stanley Gibbons, English philatelist, founder of Stanley Gibbons Ltd (b. 1840)
* June 21 – Edward Stanley Gibbons, English philatelist, founder of Stanley Gibbons Ltd. (d. 1913)
* Edward Stanley Gibbons (1840–1913), philatelist and founder of Stanley Gibbons Ltd.
thumb|Edward Stanley Gibbons (1840-1913), the founder of the firm.
The company has a long corporate history, having started as a sole trader business owned by Edward Stanley Gibbons in 1856 and now being a quoted company with a number of subsidiaries.
* 17 February – Edward Stanley Gibbons, philatelist, founder of Stanley Gibbons Ltd (born 1840)
* 21 June – Edward Stanley Gibbons, philatelic stamp dealer (died 1913)
* Edward Stanley Gibbons begins the sale of collectable postage stamps in his father's pharmacy in Plymouth, origin of the firm of Stanley Gibbons.

*Died: Edward Stanley Gibbons, English philatelist, founder of Stanley Gibbons (b. 1840); Joaquin Miller, American poet, known for poems about his experiences in the frontier including the poetry Songs of the Sierras (b. 1837)

Chapman lived in Mexico for many years and became an expert on the stamps of that country. He was one of the collectors that Edward Stanley Gibbons visited on his travels as reported in the pages of Stanley Gibbons Monthly Journal in 1895. Gibbons and his wife visited Chapman and his wife at their villa in Coyoacan which he recounted stood in extensive grounds."Oddments en Route." E. Stanley Gibbons, Stanley Gibbons Monthly Journal, 30 April 1895, pp. 158-159. Near the end of his life, Chapman helped the firm of Stanley Gibbons compile their listing of Mexican stamps and was a frequent correspondent with the philatelic press. In his later years he was bed-ridden."Obituary: Samuel Chapman". Gibbons Stamp Monthly, 1 July 1943, p. 1.
* Edward Stanley Gibbons (d. 1913), stamp dealer and founder of Stanley Gibbons Ltd, publishers of the Stanley Gibbons stamp catalogue

De Ysasi was one of the earliest members of The Philatelic Society, London, and became its vice president in May 1880."Past Presidents and Vice-Presidents of the Royal Philatelic Society, London", The London Philatelist, Vol. 22, No. 256 (April 1913), pp. 86-87. He knew Edward Stanley Gibbons, founder of the eponymous firm, and supplied him with stamps of Spain and its colonies such as Cuba, Fernando Po, the Philippines, and Puerto Rico. In return Gibbons gave him any relevant rarities that he came across."Oddments En Route", E. Stanley Gibbons, Stanley Gibbons Monthly Journal, Vol. 5, No. 56 (28 February 1895), p. 120.
